entry.title: Last chances and second glances
entry.summary:
Author: thebookofcrows

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 139,612Chapters: 40/60Kudos: 797

Summary: St. Anthony’s was his last chance, and Evan knew that. He had been kicked out of five schools in the past six years, and after his sophomore year ended with a meeting between his parents and his last headmaster that could be summarized with: “we’re not kicking him out, but just know that Evan is not welcome back in September.” His parents wanted to send him to military school.       Evan knew he couldn’t survive military school, that would be his last drop, the one that finally shattered the vase. He couldn’t be the type of person that would be able to put himself back together once they broke him down.     This had to work. . . . Buck is the new kid in an El Paso boarding school, trying his best to stay out of trouble. Eddie is a rockstar (in the world of high school popularity) he's captain to the football team, he's dating the most popular girl in school, and looking at a full ride sports scholarship in the fall. He should feel like he won at life, which is why he doesn't understand why the only time he feels alive is when he catches a glimpse of the new guy on the running team. Or in simpler terms: Buddie high-school AU!

entry.title: Buck, Bound & Broken
entry.summary:

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 20,984Chapters: 2/3Kudos: 168

Summary: “Tommy?” “Yeah, Ev?” Tommy says nonchalantly. “Uh, you took a wrong turn…” Tommy taps the steering wheel. “So, about that.” Buck should have known Tommy was going to pull something. Just the way he's driving, mainly sticking with the left side of the highway, as the way to Eddie’s house wasn’t too far from where Buck broke down. He just needed to head to the next exit. ===Buck gets taken by Tommy.

entry.title: I know they're losing (and I'll pay for my place by the ring)
entry.summary:
Author: funnyfeelingbuckley

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 16,408Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 18

Summary: It started as an outlet, at first. A way to let out his anger in a controlled manner, with a willing opponent who would offer him the pain that he deserved. He felt itchy. Teen pregnancy in a Catholic household had cloaked him with such a thick layer of shame that he needed a way to forget. It was a good thing, he tells himself. It was an honest thing - born out of good intentions. Until it wasn't. - Or Instead of enlisting in the military, Eddie makes money via an underground fight club in Texas. After threats against his family are leveled, Eddie finds a way to Los Angeles with the help of Athena Grant. Now working as private security, he begins working for Evan "Buck" Buckley, an arrogant and hot-headed singer/songwriter who may just give Eddie Diaz a run for his money.   title based on I Bet On Losing Dogs by Mitski

entry.title: The Sunlight Of My Life
entry.summary:
Author: Pnk_strawberry1

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 20,245Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 85

Summary: When Eddie left for Texas, Buck told himself he’d be fine. He had the house, the memories, and the silence — too much of it.Then a stranger shows up at his door with news that knocks the air out of him: he’s the father of an eight-year-old girl named Alina Marie Monroe.Oh — and her mother’s dead.When Eddie finally comes home, the two of them fall into a rhythm that feels almost like a family. Almost.But love gets complicated when it’s the one thing neither of them has ever had the courage to name. Between bedtime stories, quiet mornings, and the ghosts of what-ifs, Buck and Eddie begin to realize that sometimes family isn’t something you find — it’s something you build, one heartbeat at a time.Or:Buck becomes a dad. Eddie comes home. And somewhere between friendship and forever, they find the sunlight again. ☀️Ft A short Christopher & Alina Side Story!

entry.title: Buck is not Cool as a cucumber.
entry.summary:
Author: Kaiisly0615

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,792Chapters: 2/2Kudos: 18

Summary: Buck is about to leave for Seattle, but he can’t stop thinking about Eddie. two impulsive drives, one hoodie, and a lot of pent up feelings later, everything comes crashing down.   He walked the long stretch from his kitchen to the front door and turned to look at the photo one last time. He was doing this. On the drive, Eddie was white knuckling the steering wheel. He glanced at the clock on the dash.4:30. Two hours. He had two hours. Less now. He hit the gas. Cars blurred past him, but he barely noticed. His head was too full of Buck, he wished he were full of Buck.Wait, no, he shut that thought down.

Author: Duochanfan

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,126Chapters: 2/16Kudos: 102

entry.title: Take My Defenses
entry.summary:
Author: Hawkbooty

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 537,752Chapters: 57/?Kudos: 203

Summary: Edmundo "Eddie" Diaz had yet to carve out a reputation in the NHL as a Third-Line Center for the Dallas Stars, but this season was different. As he approached the milestone of a possible 20-goal season, and several star players on the roster were sidelined due to various injuries, the coaching staff chose Eddie to wear the iconic Victory Green of the Stars for this year's All-Star Game.Evan “Buck” Buckley, a star of the Los Angeles Kings, his image as a golden boy often shone brightly, but it was clouded recently by the lingering controversy stemming from his off-ice antics; clumsy mistakes had thrust him into the spotlight for all the wrong reasons. Now, as he prepared for the upcoming festivities of the All-Star Game, his Captain, Howard “Chimney” Han—who also happened to be his line partner and brother-in-law—had been entrusted to be his chaperone; this came with the privilege of sleeping in the room adjacent to his, the two spaces connected by a door.It’s uncertain what the future has in store for Buck and Eddie. Whether it involves personal growth or overcoming obstacles, only time will tell.▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬Just Another 911 Hockey AU

entry.title: Foxtrot On My Skin
entry.summary:
Author: jjntashi

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,542Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 15

Summary: “Is it true?” Buck muttered softly as he leaned his hip against the desk. He caught the professor’s mustache twitch, urging him to push further. “What they say about you? That you bump up grades in exchange for a visit under your desk?”Turns out the rumour wasn’t true. But Buck decided that didn’t mean it couldn’t be. What he didn’t know was that this was only the first of many cracks in Professor Diaz’s strict and controlled façade. A mask he had spent years perfecting, now beginning to crumble the moment Buck got a taste of what it was like to break it.

entry.title: you called me home
entry.summary:
Author: thequeenofwhump

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 28,858Chapters: 4/14Kudos: 160

Summary: Running to the frontlines from a childhood he never had. Taking a bat to the wall with his son in the next room. Having an affair with the spitting image of his dead wife. Eddie knows he’s never been good at grieving, knows he’s never been good at losing what little he allows for himself in the first place. This is why he also knows his coping mechanisms can’t possibly get any worse. Buck, as he so often does, makes him reevaluate his assumptions.—Evan Buckley dies behind a wall of glass. It’s a shame that when he’s revived not three minutes later, no one is informed.

entry.summary:
Author: whisperingcherries

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 31,696Chapters: 34/34Kudos: 23

Summary: Evan Buckley learns quickly that the psych ward is a place where doors close gently and people leave without saying goodbye. His parents sign the papers and disappear. His sister is already gone. Buck stops expecting anyone to stay. Eddie Diaz volunteers at the hospital because he believes no one should be alone in the worst moments of their life. Buck doesn’t believe in people like that.
